page.title: 09THATCHING - THE STAG'S HEAD.
page.content: {Thatching. Built in the sixteenth century, {The Stag's Head}retained its original thatched roof until 1985. Although parts of the top layers had been patched over the years, 1985 was the first time that the {wheat reed roof had been completely stripped. When all the thatch was removed, it was discovered that some of the roof timbers were just tree branches. {The new roof is made of Norfolk {reed}which is tougher than wheat reed and, according to the thatcher, is likely to last at least 60 years. {Three thousand bundles of reed were needed to thatch the roof and the total cost of the work, which took three months to complete, was{Â£21,000.
